THE POLL ON ffhr Election OF A REPRESENTATIVE IN PARLIAMENT, FOR THE COUNTY OF CAMBRIDGE, On the 27th, 28th, 29th, and 31st Days of OCTOBER, 1831; ■// TO which is added, A LIST OF THE MEMBERS FOR THE COUNTY, From 1660, to the present time. BY CHARLES HENRY COOPER. CAMBRIDGE. PUBLISHED BY BENJAMIN BRIDGES, AND SOLD BY W. WATTS WISBECH, AND ALL OTHER BOOKSELLERS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY. 1831. [ Two Shillings and Sixpence].
CAMBRIDGE : PRINTED El W. METCALFE, ST. MARV's STREET.

ADVERTISEMENT. The present Work will be found to differ in several respects from the Poll Books published on previous occasions of the like nature. The description of the Voter's property, and the names of the occupiers, have been omitted, under an impression that such infor mation (which is but of minor importance to the generality of read ers) would unnecessarily increase both the bulk and the price of the Work. The names of the Voters have been arranged under their resi dences, and not according to the situation of their freeholds. The superiority of this method of arrangement may be estimated from the circumstance, that of the 471 electors resident in Cam bridge, the freeholds of above 80 are situate in other parts of the County, and that not one of the 19 freeholders, resident in Thor ney, is possessed of freehold property in that parish. The several Towns and Parishes are classed in alphabetical order, instead of being arranged under hundreds ; whilst, at the same time, the strength of particular districts may be readily esti mated from the Tables of the Voters in each hundred and parish given at the end. The List of Members for the County, from 1660 to the present time, (which will be found more correct than any hitherto published,) will, it is hoped, be considered an interesting addition to a Work of this description. It only remains for the Editor to add, that he trusts the altera tions he has made will render this Work more easy of reference, and of more general utility than any former publication ofthe same kind — that no exertions have been spared to render the Work as correct as possible, and that he flatters himself no mistake, of any impor tance, has been committed. Cambridge, Nov. 21, 1831.

/ SHORTLY WILL BE PUBLISHED. (BY SUBSCRIPTION,) Historical and Descriptive Account of the UNIVERSITY AND TOWN OF CAMBRIDGE. This Work will contain : I. A Narration of the principal events connected with the History of the University and Town, from the remotest period to the present time, — In this portion of the Work, will be embodied Abstracts of the principal Charters, and other public Documents granted to or concerning the University, or the Corporation. II. An Account of the University; — its Officers and Professors, the several kinds of Students and Graduates, its Privileges and Benefactors, and its public and colle gate Establishments. III. Various particulars relating to Ecclesiastical Matters; Accounts of the •tarious Religious Houses, Churches, Chapels, Gilds, and Religious Societies. IV. Particulars relating to the Corporation; — its Officers and Members, its Privileges, Laws, and Revenue, and to the several Ecclesiastical and Temporal Courts held within the Town ; with an Account of some ancient legal customs and exemptions. V. A Description of the several Churches, Colleges, Libraries, and other Public Buildings, including an account of the various Monuments, Statues, Pictures, and ; other objects of Curiosity, and the blazonry of many hundred coats of Arms. VI. Miscellaneous particulars, including Notices respecting the Population — j Trade — Markets — Fairs — Taxes — Tolls — Pavement and Roads — Bridges — Naviga- tion — Supply of Water — Manors — Common and Waste Lands — Fisheries — Military affairs, &c. &c. VII. Accounts of the various Noblemen who have taken their titles of Honour iftwm the Town ; and a History of the Parliamentary Representation both of the Town and University. VIII. Particulars relative to the several Free Schools, Hospitals, Alms' Houses and other charitable and benevolent Institutions. IX. Lives of eminent natives of Cambridge, and an Alphabetical List of between 2000 and 3000 Great Officers of state, Prelates, Judges, Authors, and distinguished and remarkable persons, who have been or are Members of the University, with a succinct account of their several Academical Honours, Preferments, Works, &c. and the names of their respective Colleges. X. Appendix containing — 1st, a Catalogue of above 400 printed Books, Pam phlets, 8cc. relating to Cambridge, and 2dly, a Chronological List of nearly 2000 Records and Documents relating to the University, the Town, and the several Colleges, Parishes, and Public Institutions, with numerous references to the places where the originals are deposited or Copies may be seen. In various parts of the Work will be inserted correct Lists of the Heads of the several Colleges, and of the principal Officers, Professors, and Representatives in Parliament, of the University ; together with similar Lists of the more important Officers of the Corporation, and of the Members of I'arliament for the Town ; and the whole will be rendered complete by the insertion throughout of illustrative notes, and the addition of copious Local and Nominal Indices, and a List of Subscribers. Flan of Publication : The Work will be printed in quarto parts, to be published occasionally, (each part containing 160 pag"sl at the price of 10s. 6d. For the accommodation of gentlemen who prefer that sii,^, soiu^ -» ;»<* w;" »*e printed on Royal octavo paper, at the reduced price of 8s. each part. As far as a judgment can be formed, the number of parts will not exceed eight, which number will make two large and handsome volumes.
